oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessing differences in early lactation milk constituent estimates between Holstein cows of varying health outcomes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McArt, J. A. A.
Teplitz, E. M.
Callero, K. R.
Seminara, J. A.
Frost, I. R.
McCray, H. A.
Martinez, R.
Barbano, D. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cows have an increased risk of disease shortly after parturition due to the energy and macromineral demands that occur secÂ­ondary to the initiation of lactation. Our objective was to assess the feasibility of identifying a healthy or maladaptive transition using Fourier-transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy of milk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 55 (2022): 2022 Annual Conference Proceedings; 228
